meanings.definition: In a manner that produces a series of sharp, short sounds.
meanings.sent1: The pots and pans rattlingly clattered to the floor.
meanings.sent2: The train rattlingly sped down the tracks.
meanings.sent3: The wind rattlingly played a tune on the chimes outside.
meanings.sent4: Her teeth chattered rattlingly in the cold.
meanings.sent5: The hail rattlingly pounded against the windows.

meanings.definition: In a way that is very fast or energetic.
meanings.sent1: The kids rattlingly raced to the playground.
meanings.sent2: The cheetah ran rattlingly across the savanna.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel rattlingly darted up the tree with the acorn.
meanings.sent4: Her heart beat rattlingly with excitement.
meanings.sent5: The dancers moved rattlingly to the beat of the music.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is very impressive or striking.
meanings.sent1: The fireworks display ended rattlingly with a grand finale.
meanings.sent2: The magician performed rattlingly in front of the amazed audience.
meanings.sent3: The painting rattlingly captured the essence of the sunset.
meanings.sent4: His speech ended rattlingly with a powerful message.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm approached rattlingly, darkening the sky.
